description: Fills null, empty, and missing values in data using various strategies including statistical methods, forward/backward fill, and interpolation.

data.info: Data containing null values to be filled. Can be a list of Data objects, single Data object, or JSON string.

default_strategy.info: Default strategy to use for filling null values across all fields.

default_fill_value.info: Default value to use when strategy is 'constant'. Will be converted to appropriate data type.

use_field_strategies.info: Enable different fill strategies for individual fields based on field configuration.

field_strategies.info: JSON configuration defining specific fill strategies for individual fields.

treat_empty_string_as_null.info: Consider empty strings ("") as null values that need to be filled.

treat_whitespace_as_null.info: Consider strings with only whitespace characters as null values.

custom_null_values.info: JSON array of custom values that should be treated as null (e.g., "N/A", "NULL", "-").

preserve_original_order.info: Maintain the original order of records in the output data.

include_statistics.info: Generate detailed statistics about the fill operation in the report.

validate_after_fill.info: Perform validation after filling to ensure no null values remain.

errors.no_data: No input data provided for null filling.
errors.empty_data: Input data is empty or contains no records.
errors.invalid_json: Invalid JSON format in input data.
errors.no_fill_run: Null filling must be run before accessing this output.
